reviews.text: Every bite was delicious, especially the appetizers. Best to come with a group of friends and try a little bit of everything, because everything is great!

This place is delightful.

The food is really delicious and well executed. We ordered several dishes to share including the beef pie which I thought was good.  Standouts for me were the potato mille-feuille (the sauce was one of the highlights of the night) and the Hokkaido somen (the dish I wish I didn't have to share).

We split two desserts - the panna cotta and banana sundae. That sundae was mind-blowingly good.  There was no reason that it should be that good, but it was unanimously our favorite.

Service was outstanding and the restaurant was understated and lovely.
One of the best restaurants in Greenpoint. Incredible food and amazing service!! This placeâ€™s got my heart. ğŸ’˜

Lingo is a fantastic brunch spot with a unique Japanese-inspired menuâ€”refreshing and different from the usual.
Perfect place for catching up with friends, with a cozy and stylish atmosphere.
The manager provided outstanding service, making the whole experience even more enjoyable. Highly recommend!
Great Sunday brunch.

First time visit with friends and it was wonderful. Service was amazing! The space was beautiful! And Iâ€™m confused about the not so great reviews because everything we ate was delicious. I went with 3 other friends and we shared a few plates and everything was fantastic. It was a quiet Wednesday evening so I donâ€™t know if that mattered compared to visiting during a weekend or busy brunch hour. But definitely would recommend!

We had an amazing weekend lunch at Lingo with friends! The food was absolutely delicious â€” fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. Every dish we tried was full of taste and clearly made with care. The atmosphere was lively and fun, and the service was friendly and attentive. Definitely a place Iâ€™d recommend for a relaxed and satisfying meal with friends! ğŸ½ï¸âœ¨
Really interesting fusion, had a memorable time here. Iâ€™d recommend to all pie lovers.

Honestly really disappointing brunch. Came because of the good reviews but the food was just not good.

We got the duck confit sandwich for $41 which was fine, the beef pie which was okay, but the worst part was the fries. Walked by the kitchen and see a huge bag of frozen fries just being used for the dishes and they tasted terrible.

Drinks we're good and the service was good too but food was a total miss.

Spicy chicken sandwichè¿˜ä»¥ä¸ºæ˜¯æ—¥å¼ä¸‰æ˜æ²»ï¼Œä¸Šæ¥ç»™æˆ‘ä¸ªç¾å¼å¤§æ±‰å ¡ï¼Œè¿˜å¾ˆéš¾åƒğŸ˜…
pancakeè¿˜ä¸é”™
Yuzu sparklingé…¸çš„ä¸è¡ŒâŒ
Its a fine place. For some reason, dishes can be inconsistent. That being said, the pancakes are top tier. ğŸ‘Œ

Food is mid, overpriced and small portions. Service was attentive and atmosphere was nice. Will not be back. Hokkaido milk bread was atrocious, it is nothing like it, very dense and stale. The group was not full at all after ordering half the menu.

The beef pie (not pictured because we ate that in like ten seconds) is absolutely scrumptious, however the rest of the dishes were nothing to really write home about (though they didnâ€™t taste bad at all). Like someone said, not the best Japanese fusion place but I definitely think their beef pie is worth a visit.

Otherwise servers were very nice, atmosphere however didnâ€™t feel very Japanese at all for a Japanese fusion restaurant lol

This Thi restaurant in Brooklyn was so delicious if you like Thi give this a go. Wednesday 40% off wine. It'scalled Lingo. The food was so exciting and balanced flavors! Their bold original menu reflects a deep love of flavors as well as an educated chef who pulls off their amazing flavors.  Can't recommend enough!
You cannot leave without trying the dessert. Wow. What a perfect way to end our meal. Thank you for a memorable evening!

My partner and I visited for brunch and had a great experience. The service was exceptional â€” the staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. The restaurant, including the bathroom, was very clean and well-maintained.

We ordered the Japanese breakfast set and the apple tart tatin pancakes. The short rib in the breakfast set was a highlight â€” beautifully cooked, juicy, tender, and perfectly seasoned. The tomato soup, however, was a bit too salty for our taste.

The pancakes were light and fluffy, which I really enjoyed. However, I wasnâ€™t a fan of the apple and miso caramel topping. The apple lacked flavor, and the miso caramel had a bitter note that didnâ€™t quite work for me.

Came in with a small group. You can tell the space is extremely well polished. The food and service were brilliant. The owner (im assuming--long hair man) is also a great resource for any of your wine needs. He recommended us a wine that fit with our entire meal--one we were not familiar with but enjoyed a lot. He explain about the importance of flavor and texture balancing between food and drink in a way I did not think of. Lovely evening. Thank you Lingo. I recommend the octopus crudo
Impeccable and most delicious food. And the service was absolutely top tier. They had overheard us chatting about my fiancÃ©â€˜s birthday the following week and they even brought us an extra dessert.

Wow what an amazing dining experience.
Everything was so flavorful and so unique!

My top dishes were:
1. Hokkaido seafood somen noodles. So refreshing and full of amazing seafood flavor without being extremely strong or pungent.
2. Niku short rib jaga - meat was perfectly cooked and combined perfectly with the dashi flavor.
3. Lingo Beef pie - very hearty and aromatic. Delicious but did not stand out other than it's presentation. Probably the most American-inspired of all their dishes.

Also the cocktails were hitting the spot. Would for sure come here again.

wanted to try lingo for so long. milk bread was awesome, less like a milk bread & more like a pudding-y challah. (fantastic.) beef pie, with a curry interior, missed the mark on including potatoes & carrots, characteristic of both pot pie & curry. we heard lots about this item and flocked to try it. the gravy was a little thin & so we think a solution could be more items in the interior. also a bottom crust as opposed to only a top crust would be a great touch. the short rib was great, though the wasabi/potato recommended pairing was not for me. liked the gentle truffle taste in the gravy. the potatoes were great. the chicken meatball was very umami. needed a little seasoning on chicken. the pudding, a flan, had a VERY overpowering orange flavor that overshadowed the peach. the mousse cake was rich, chocolatey, bit dense, good.

I absolutely loved this Japanese fusion restaurant â€” the flavors and creativity were spot on!

We started with the chawanmushi, a delicately steamed egg custard served in a charming teacup. The addition of aged Parmesan was such a delightful twist â€” as a cheese lover, I was amazed by how perfectly it blended with the dish.

Next came the roasted bone marrow steak tartare, which was easily a 10/10. At first, I thought it was just presented in a marrow bone, but it actually incorporated the rich, juicy marrow into the tartare itself. The depth of flavor was unlike any tartare Iâ€™ve had before â€” incredibly savory and indulgent.

For mains, we shared the Lingo Beef Pie along with the Grilled Wild Scallion and Corn Donabe Rice. The beef pie was hearty and delicious, while the donabe rice stood out with its bright hint of lemon zest that added such a refreshing kick. The tempura corn and mushrooms on top were the perfect crispy, flavorful touch.

Iâ€™d highly recommend dining here â€” and as a bonus, the restaurant sits right by the waterfront. Coming at sunset, when the sky turns shades of orange and pink over the cityscape, makes the whole experience even more special ğŸ¥°
Excellent food and service. Thank you
We were there for my sonâ€™s birthday dinner. Ashi made us feel so special. All their dishes are scrumptious and presented so beautifully. The service was great and the drinks stellar.

Extremely welcoming and the staff is attentive.. The food is absolutely amazing.. It does not matter what type of food regimen youâ€™re on.. this place hits all the spotsâ€¦ so worth it!! You Will not be disappointed ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼

Not the best Japanese fusion but not the worst. Cod sand was the best thing on the table. The spiral potato was a little greasy and less flavorful than advertised on the menu. The apple tart tatin pancakes were very mid -- they looked very impressive but the batter was quite eggy, but not too sweet which is good if that's what you are looking for. Overall not bad.
The best. From the hospitality to the food. Highly recommend.
Staff were super nice. Food was amazing â€” Hokkaido milk bread is a must have!

Everything was amazing here. Food was spectacular and the service was phenomenal. Would definitely come back. The vegetarian curry pie was amazing and everyone enjoyed their cocktails. Weâ€™ll be back!

We had an absolutely fantastic experience at Lingo for brunch. The food was delicious. Definitely recommend the Japanese set for a wide sampling of different foods. The sandos were also delicious. We shared the pancakes and holy cow, one of the best pancakes Iâ€™ve ever had. Not one to miss - Iâ€™ll be back for dinner.

My fiancÃ© took me here after we got engaged as a surprise and it was lovely! The drinks were delicious and so was the brunch. Definitely a bit different flavor wise but I loved that about it. Our waiter was also very kind and brought us champagne to celebrate our engagementğŸ’ğŸ¤
Wonderful restaurant. Amazing how consistent the food is. A real treat!

Calm, comfortable aesthetic spot with ample seating and tailored menu. We made reservations for a party of 2 at 6pm on a Fri. They have an outdoor space as well. We got 3 dishes and felt that it was enough to fill between 2 people. What we got:

- Roasted Bone Marrow Steak Tartare: 5/5 - Really enjoyed this dish! It came with several pieces of nori, which paired so well with the fatty bone marrow and fresh uni and tartare.
- Crispy Potato Mille Feuille: 3.8/5 - Not as big of a deal as ppl make it out to be. Maybe we got an off-batch - ours was a tad undercooked, so it was a bit crunchier than I liked, plus the flavor was nothing life changing.
- Lingo Beef Pie: 4.5/5 - Pretty good, but superr savory. Docking 1/2 pt bc I wish the dish came with some rice or bread - just something to pair with the curry, but the meat was tasty and tender!

Staff were superr attentive and came around multiple times to refill our cups (granted, the water cups are quite small haha). Overall, would recommend for a decent meal!
Such a welcoming environment and kind owner!

We had a wonderful meal at Lingo on a recent Saturday- it was very busy and had such a lovely ambiance, staff were uniformly welcoming and gracious. The food was so delicious- lots of mixed flavors and delights. We loved the octopus carpaccio, steak tartare, cabbage with tahini, the Miso cod, steak pie and lime ice cream. Sake accompaniment was perfect. We will be back -Thank you all

They are what I call an affordable fine-dining. The vibe is casually elegant and the food is superb, so top notch! The stone bowl rice with baby corns reminds me of the Cantonese stone bowl rice and the Korean stone bowl bibimbap. The rice is slightly charred by the hot stone bowl, resulting in a nice crunchy texture and it is simmered in the subtle sweetness of corns. ğŸ¤¤ The octopus is like a Nikkei ceviche. The dessert is an oolong tea soft swerve with white peach, and I love a slightly bitter sweetness which adds depth and layers. What a wonderful fusion of cultures and flavors!

We had a disappointing experience.
After a long workday, we were starving and wanted to start with simple appetizers before ordering drinks and main courses. However
our server said we must start with the drinks first and she insisted that we place our entire order at once. She mentioned a 30-minute wait for food making us feel rushed and uncomfortable. To make matters worse, they just opened and we were the only customers in the restaurant at the time.

Since it was our first visit, we asked for recommendations, but she simply went through the menu without providing any helpful suggestions.

The food was okay, but not worth the prices.

Excellent in all categories. And Wednesday is great day to dine there for the 40% off glasses and bottles of wine.  Great Happy Hour too!

We had an amazing experience here this evening. The atmosphere was extremely relaxing and chill. The simple artistic decor creates a serene atmosphere. The food is delicious. We especially loved the beef tartar, duck, miso cod, milk bread, and shirt rib. Sticky toffee pudding was rich, but somewhat delicate. Cocktails were well balanced. Everyone was extremely attentive and the attention to detail made the entire experience one to cherish. I highly recommend this place. It's tucked away, but worth the trip. Looking forward to our next visit!

Tried Lingo in Greenpoint and it absolutely delivered. We shared the Japanese breakfast set with short ribâ€”spectacular. The meat was incredibly tender and packed with flavor. The tomato miso soup was an unexpected but interesting twist, and even the little hot dog was a fun, tasty touch. The chicken sando was another highlightâ€”crispy, juicy, and satisfying. And donâ€™t sleep on the friesâ€”theyâ€™re seriously addictive. Great meal all around. Iâ€™ll definitely be going back
Perfect brunch date spot!
Delicious food & nice outdoor seating area.

My +1 and I sat at the bar and were recommended a few dishes by the nice & attentive bartenders from the menu â€” all of them were delicious. The hamachi appetizer is one of the best sashimi dishes Iâ€™ve ever had. We will definitely be back!

I visited around noon on a weekend and didn't need a reservation. They seated us right away. My friend and I each ordered the Japanese Breakfast Set ($28)--one with the cedar-wrapped shio koji arctic char, and the other with the grilled kalbi short rib. Both came with rice, tsukemono, miso soup, onsen egg, and seasonal vegetables. (There's also an optional salmon ikura add-on for $6.)

The space has a clean, rustic decor that I really loved. The portions were just right, and the food was delicious. It's a bit on the pricey side, but honestly worth it for the quality and experience. I'd definitely come back again.

Five star experience. Hidden away on a dead end block is this gem. We ordered 7 food items: Pickles, potato millefuille, cabbage, steak tartare, pate, duck, and rice. Each dish is executed so precisely that each bite tastes amazing. Rarely, do I not only want to come back again but I want to reorder all the same items as well as the rest of the menu. Best surprise restaurant in awhile.

We came on a Friday night and the restaurant was at capacity. Highly recommend getting a reservation in advance. The food was great! The bread was sooo warm and yummy! I also really liked the beef pie and the cod. The vibe of this place was also nice and it had good acoustics. Itâ€™s perfect for a date night or a group.
Sneaking up on being Williamsburg's best restaurant. Japanese fusion is very imaginative and delicious. Can be a little loud.

I came here for brunch one weekend and had a phenomenal meal. Located in Greenpoint, this restaurant is right near the water, and is vibrant and lively. Staff was lovely, but we did have an issue with the hostess. Our reservation was at 12pm, but after my friend was seated (she came a bit late), the hostess said that our table was needed back at 1pm. Although I understand that my friend was late, it was weird that they would only allow an hour of dining/seating. So, throughout our meal we were a bit worried, uncomfortable, and felt rushed.

Service aside, the food was amazing. We got the miso caramel pancakes and the beef pie with hokkaido milk bread (you have to order it separately). A perfect blend of sweet and savory brunch. The miso caramel pancakes come in a stack of two, but we just got the single stack to share. It was fluffy, a huge portion, and came with a scoop of ice cream on top. The beef pie was AMAZING, and paired so well with the hokkaido milk bread (which also came with sake butter). Would love to come back here for their dinner service.

Iâ€™ve been here twice and had a fantastic experience both times! Service was excellent and the food is really unique. The price point is a little high but itâ€™s one of my favorite places to celebrate a special occasion.
Beef pot pie ğŸ’¯ğŸ’¯

The good: Excellent hospitality. The hamachi and seafood bouillabaisse udon (weekend only dish) were highlights of the evening. Cocktails were unique and well made.

The not so good: The potato mille feuille was well executed but bland. The beef pie, a total overhype. While the beef was tender, the curry was too watery and too sweet. It was also not accompanied by rice, a small bowl came at an extra cost ($5) honestlyâ€¦kind of wild. The flan dessert was terrible.

Some of the best pancakes Iâ€™ve ever had for brunch, it was dense but crunchy at the same time.

Fried chicken sandwich was good but a bit too sour for me and the crispy rice was good too. Hokkaido milk bread was lukewarm at best and couldâ€™ve been more golden
Excellent food. Great service! The lingo beef pie is unique and delicious. The pancakes are perfection. The sticky toffee pudding is unlike anything else; the lime ice cream makes it one of a kind.

We had a fantastic brunch at Lingo today with my family. It was a casual atmosphere and the service was top notch. The food did not disappoint as we ate many of the items on the menu. Highly recommend the Apple Tart Tatin pancakes and the Lingo Beef Pie (a take on chicken pot pie but itâ€™s made out of Japanese beef curry) but we really enjoyed everything. We have to come back and try the dinner menu!

Iâ€™m not sure how this place has 4.7 stars. I came here a while ago back in November. The crispy chicken dish was crispy but very bland. And the whole time I was eating the duck dish, I was like why did I get this. The sweet sauce/jam completely overpowered the already lacking flavours of the duck. The sticky toffee pudding was also a let down. It was so dry, the cake has to be soaked in that toffee. The crispy potatoes with caviar was okay but again the potatoes tasted quite bland. It was the worst birthday dinner Iâ€™ve had so far in nyc. This place is overpriced for average food But at least the service was very good

Lingo is a unique restaurant that brings an innovative blend of Japanese and American cuisine to Brooklyn's Greenpoint neighborhood. The menu features intriguing fusion dishes that delight the taste buds. Among the standout items are the soft and flavorful buttermilk bread, the savory beef pie, and the refreshing octopus cold salad. Each dish showcases a harmonious balance of flavors and textures, making Lingo a must-visit destination for food enthusiasts looking to experience a creative culinary adventure. The inviting atmosphere and attentive service further enhance the dining experience. Additionally, Lingo features a dog-friendly patio, making it a great spot for pet owners to enjoy a meal with their furry friends. This combination of excellent food, warm ambiance, and pet-friendly policy makes Lingo a gem in Greenpoint's vibrant food scene.

5 stars just based on the dessert alone - the banana parfait is out of this world!! So many textures and not too sweet at all. Itâ€™s pretty big so be prepared to share with 2 but no less than 3 since youâ€™ll want more!

Rest of the food was great, not phenomenal or mind blowing but I think I would come back to try more. The pate was very small as a half portion but the accompanying jams were fantastic and the potato mille feuille itself was under seasoned but the dashi cream on the side was so yummy and paired beautifully.

Please donâ€™t get the pieâ€¦very underwhelming and overrated - just looks nice and I think japanese box curry has more flavor.

Super gorgeous spot with very attentive and helpful service. Dishes were all interesting to try and presentation was very nice. Highlights were the octopus carpaccio (though could use a few more pieces of the sweet citrus to balance the flavors of the sauce a bit more), chawanmushi, and lime ice cream. Agree with another viewer that the beef pie would be perfect with some plain white rice as itâ€™s a very rich and salty curry. The potato (was expecting it to be crispy on the outside) and bread were alright, glad to have tried them though!

Trendy Japanese American restaurant in Greenpoint. Mostly I prefer a classic way but one in a blue moon I just want to go for something creative and contemporary. I sturdy their menu before I go, so I know what to order and save the server so much time with super busy place.

Food is wonderful in every dishes. Miso Black Cod is beautiful and taste, Somen Noodles is good, Octopus Carpaccio is recommended, Chawanmushi is lovely, Steak tartare is awesome, and I can't miss Mille-Feuille potato that a must. Lingo and Shiro drinks are fantastic then close the meal by Sticky Toffee Pudding giving me a happiness.

Service is good but with the price point I spend at this restaurant, I kind of expected more in term of paying attention to customer order, cooking time and customer needs. Overall if you have a date night or special occasion, I will recommend this place for new and modern experiences. Suggest, marking a reservation before you go.

A fusion-style restaurant twisting dishes with Japanese tastes. For me items were kinda a hit or a miss but our visit was smooth and relax.

The best one that night in my opinion was the iconic ğŸ¥§âœ¨Beef Pie. The portion was huge, came out so hot. The curry was in a Japanese style that made me wanna ask for a bowl of white rice, reminded me my trip to Japan. Meat inside was a lot as well, and the crust was soooo crispy.

The Mille Feuille potato was outstanding too, my friend liked it a lot. It was delicious but I personally think it would be great to make the potato slightly more salty and make the butter less flavored.

Duck breast was kinda dry but I like the idea that you get to taste it cooked in two different ways.

Last, the sticky toffee pudding. I like the ğŸ‹ğŸ¨lime ice cream so much. The toffee pudding was a little bit too sweet. It was fluffy, airy but dry.

the overall vibe of the restaurant really mirrors this upscale aesthetic that we've been seeing in greenpoint especially in this little corner that has a lot of Japanese influenced shops and owners, and the apple tartine pancakes were theâ€¦

Giving the food 3 stars because I got food poisoning there. I messaged the staff on IG the night I ate there and what I had to inform them and potentially stop the spread but never heard back.

Overall the food was great minus the getting sick part. The potatoâ€™s with caviar is a must have. We also ordered the Uni appetizer and the crudo - which one of the two caused my food poisoning Iâ€™m sure.

There are a lot of great food items so recommendation going with a larger group so you can try more things.

Great cocktails, unique menu and cozy vibes. The dessert wasnâ€™t mind blowing (we got 2) so skip it if youâ€™re too full.

â¤ï¸ Overview:
Went here for brunch on a Sunday on a double date. My husband was super excited so he ordered all the things so we could try as much as possible. When I looked at the menu, I literally wanted to order everything because everything look good. I was like how am I going to choose? The inside was super cute and they had back outdoor seating as well!

All the food we ordered was yummy! Nothing disappointed. I got the miso cod sando and it was yummy. I love miso black cod so when I see it, I always want to get it. I will say, I think I prefer miso black cod with rice over having it in a sandwich. But thatâ€™s just my personal preference! My husband loved all the things he ordered. I know we will be back for sure, and we also want to see how their dinner is!

â¤ï¸What was ordered:
FOOD: Yuzu ricotta pancakes, spam eggs Benedict, miso black cod sando, bacon kimchi fried rice, duck confit katsu sando (D.L.T), mini smoked tamago sando, typhoon potato, Hokkaido milk bread

DRINK: Matsuyama - Arnold Palmer (without shiso), yuzu Bloody Mary, haiboru highball

â¤ï¸Stand outs:
Spam eggs Benedict, typhoon potato, miso cod sandwich

â¤ï¸Would I come back/recommend:
Yes - I would definitely come back! I want to see what their dinner has to offer ğŸ¤£ğŸ˜
Yes - I would definitely recommend

â¤ï¸Reservations (Y/N):
Yes - I made a reservation the morning of for brunch

I had went with some of my lovely friends for dinner. Easily located, two blocks from the Greenpoint ave train station (G). For us, it was a treat to visit such a beautiful place. The atmosphere was calming, modern and welcoming. The decor was great and the seats very comfortable. The food was delicious!  We had decided to do family style so we can try a bit of everything and it was worth it. Every dish placed in front of us, tasted better and better. From the cocktails, the appetizers of steak tartare and Wagyu Sando to our main entree of the Brainzo and Fried Corn rice, everything was amazing. The food was flavorful, and fresh. You can tell that the ingredients chosen, was meant to bring the core quality of the dish. I am truly impressed by the wonders that Chef Emily Yuen has produced and looking forward to go again. We ended our night with 3 different desserts. My personal fave was the panna cotta. I do suggest going wuth friends as you all will have a great time!

Incredible service and a lovely atmosphere. Food was very solid. I enjoyed the milk bread with miso butter and the octopus carpaccio the most. The chawanmushi was also nice. The beef stew pot pie was a bit too sweet for a savory dish for my liking. We also had the cauliflower, potatoes, and sando. Prepared with a lot of love and expertise. Very good.

The food and drinks were delicious. Thereâ€™s still half of the menu I need to go back for!

The service team was knowledgeable and very kind.

Make sure to get the fried rice!

Dining room has bad acoustics if you have an overly boisterous neighbor.

I came here for a brunch and the pancake, omg, it was so good. Milk bread was so hood too. Their Japanese breakfast was amazing too but it is something that you can get any other good japanese restaurants. Mushroom ricotta toast was def one of my favorite!Loved everything and canâ€™t wait to go back.

The food are so delicious ! Very creative Japanese dishes ! Love everything I had !
The bread with the sake butter is gorgeous, I would definitely come back for that again. We also had the Scallop Crudo with pickled berries and jello, so refreshing ! For the main, we had the Lingo Beef Pie, so hearty so filling :) Including the desert toffee pudding, we had 3 dishes served in skillet pans, which keep them warm and cute for the whole dinner.

Service is great, art being displayed are great, if theres one thing to improve, it would be the bathroom. they only have a bathroom and there is always a wait, other than that, its wonderful.

Edit as I can't reply to owner:
I just want you to know that we were not offered anything at all at the end of our meal. I was trying to order a dessert at the end because you have one of my favorite British desserts (sticky toffee pudding) but was told only one item did not have egg (the grape ice cream) but at no point was it offered in lieu of your lovely birthday treats being passed around. I do want to let you know that a few things felt a bit exasperating, but I gave the benefit of the doubt each time - when seated, we were given the far corner table away from everyone else, but we thought - oh maybe they're trying to give us privacy. Then when we weren't offered anything for the special occasion I thought to myself, oh it's probably the egg but they could have at least acknowledged me or taken my mocktail off the bill. And then when we saw the coat rack we thought, oh maybe it was full when we came in. But at some point you just realize that the communication is either really poor, or a second thought. If given a choice, I would have picked a different empty table of which there were many. And if offered a celebratory treat I would have appreciated it because Christmas adjacent birthdays are absolutely the worst ğŸ˜“ and people hate having their coat collect dust on the floor. The food is good but the service really needs a little improvement and consistency. I'm disappointed that whoever told you that we were offered something was not telling the truth.

I REALLY wanted to like this place.

I'm going to smack whichever Instagram influencer beguiled me enough to spend my birthday dinner here. I knew immediately when I walked inside and felt overdressed that I probably picked the wrong restaurant for my special occasion. The food is fairly interactive - bone marrow has steak tartar that you assemble with nori which was such an interesting twist on a bone marrow dish. Beef curry pie has a smoldering rosemary stem coming out of a piece of bone marrow but the curry was very one note. The mushroom rice was very unsalted so you missed out on all the great mushroom flavors. Food was good but for the price point it's just not quite good enough.

For a low key meal this will probably meet expectations, but for the prices here I thought it would be a little more refined, interesting on the palate and proudly served. One very hard working server was taking care of the entire seating area to the best of his ability but there was no sparkling conversation or personalized attentiveness. I think I just set my expectations too high because of all the online accolades. Lighting is very dim so not super great for photos or big energy.

Not only did I watch 4 other ppl get birthday desserts while we were passed up tonight (the special occasion and allergy instructions never made it to the server I'm guessing) but on my way out we see a coat rack and on the coldest night of the year having many layers on we were not offered to have our coats hung up when we walked in. So for a birthday dinner I ended up feeling like I got subpar service, a missed birthday treat (could have gone elsewhere) and an expensive but mediocre meal. Maybe if I just came in for a regular dinner without all the hype I would have been less disappointed. Will not be back though. For half the money you can get better food at Wanpaku.

We tried out this new restaurant in greenpoint and i'm giving a 5 star because I believe this restaurant has potential to grow! I love the interior and the vibe of this restaurant. Not sure if its usually loud but as it got later in the night it was hard to hear. The service was very fast and attentive. The cocktails were good I got the Kyuri which was refreshing (not in the pic) and the Hinagiku which is their take on margarita. I particularly was interested if the  yuzu kosho syrup would work well with this cocktail it's a 50/50 for me but i love the shiso salt used. The apps were good my favorite is the steak tartare! it's a must order! The Tempura sweet corn and garlic scape and bread was okay. For the main course we asked for the skirt steak and beef pie. We asked medium rare for the doneness however i think it came out well done. Also if you eat the skirt steak as is, it's slightly salty but if you eat it together with the carrots and the sauce it brings out a different flavor profile! (i also love the carrots) The beef pie looked aesthetically pleasing. The first bite was really good and the beef was tender however it tasted slightly burned. We enjoyed our time everybody was very nice and shout out to our waitress Wahita she was kind and attentive.  I also would love to see a seasonal menu in the near future!

Was looking forward to this meal but unfortunately we were all disappointed ğŸ˜” The place was busy and ventilation was poor so the burning herb smell was strong right when we walked in.

I didnâ€™t find anything that I liked in particular. They were mostly average but the desserts (especially the panna cotta) tasted funny to me. Overall Iâ€™d say the restaurant is alright but definitely expensive. Their classification is accurate so go in expecting western food inspired by Japanese cuisine, but the flavor is not going to be Japanese.
The pot pie is best delicious; base on instagram.  My family decided to give a try; we all sharing the dishes short ribs & sandwiches.  Definitely will repeat.

made a sunday reservation for brunch w a close friend! weâ€™ve been wanting to try this restaurant for a while and so glad we did! everything we ordered was so fricking delicious, Iâ€™m definitely coming back here more than once. we ordered eggs benedict, japanese breakfast set, and their yuzu pancakes. the breakfast set with the salmon was SO SO delicious. I wish I got to try more menu items but that will be for another time! highly recommend coming here for brunch :).
